title: Dredd with Portishead score
description:
"Dredd with Portishead score" 720p

The album "Drokk" by Ben Salisbury and Geoff Barrow (of Portishead) developed out of the score they composed for the 2012 movie "Dredd," which was not used in the final film. As many reviews of Drokk have mentioned, it's basically begging for a fan edit of Dredd that incorporates the music of Drokk in place of the existing score.

The results are so "Escape From New York," that it made me want to de-saturate the colors and substitute title cards with the appropriate font. It's also mixed in mono, which both helps it sound like an early 80s movie and was a lot less complicated for me.

Hope you enjoy what I like to call "John Carpenter's Judge Dredd".


- The Humaniac
